## Configuring User
```shell
# Setup username
git config --global user.name "billbenntt@gapp.nthu.edu.tw"
# Setup email
git config --global user.email billbenntt@gapp.nthu.edu.tw
git config --global user.email billbenntt@gapp.nthu.edu.tw

```



<!-- SSH Keys -->

## Login with SSH Key
```shell
# Generating Key with Email
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "billbenntt@gapp.nthu.edu.tw"

# Merge all the new changes
> Enter a file in which to save the key (/c/Users/you/.ssh/id_ed25519):[Press enter]
> Enter passphrase (empty for no passphrase): [Type a passphrase] *headmaster*
> Enter same passphrase again: [Type passphrase again]

# Copies the contents of the id_ed25519.pub file to your clipboard
$ clip < ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub

# SSH and GPG keys Integration
Paste the key on the field
```

<!-- LOCAL REPOSITORY -->

## Create Local Repo


```shell
# 1. (CD) to desired directory
# 2. Initialize on terminal 
git init
# 3. Make Changes on files
# 4. Check Status
git status
# 5. Stage the changes
# Single File
git add filename.ext
# All the files
git add .
# 6. Commit the Changes
git commit -m "Initial Commit"
```

 
<!-- REMOTE REPOSITORY -->

## Create Remote Repo

```shell
# 1. Create new repo on GitHub Website
# 2. Copy Target Repository
# 3. Run the following Command
git remote add origin https://github.com/username/reponame.git
# 4. Push the Commited Changes into the repository(origin)
git push -u origin master
# 5. Git will promtp you to login into github
```

# Visual Studio Flags

* **A** - Added (This is a new file that has been added to the repository)
* **M** - Modified (An existing file has been changed)
* **D** - Deleted (a file has been deleted)
* **U** - Untracked (The file is new or has been changed but has not been added to the repository yet)
* **C** - Conflict (There is a conflict in the file)
* **R** - Renamed (The file has been renamed)
